intro: Tragacantha seidabadensis, commonly known as the Seidabad thornapple, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a latex sap that is sometimes used in traditional medicine. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
